docs.lead_paragraph: The Republican caucus in Nevada, to be held on Saturday, has been overshadowed by far by the Democrats' lively race there and the fact that most of the Republican candidates have been consumed with campaigning in South Carolina, where the G.O.P. primary will be held Saturday.

headline.main: The Early Word: Nevada and S.C. Prime for Primaries

docs.abstract: Republican voters will be watching this weekend's primaries in Nevada and South Carolina to see if any candidate emerges as the leader the party craves.
docs.snippet: Republican voters will be watching this weekend's primaries in Nevada and South Carolina to see if any candidate emerges as the leader the party craves.

docs.lead_paragraph: The "biggest fairy tale" in this year's Democratic contest may be the hope, expressed with renewed vigor by both Barack Obama and Hillary Clinton at Tuesday night's Democratic debate, that, as the campaign moves forward, they will be viewed as "individuals" and not as representatives of their gender or race.

headline.main: For Clinton and Obama, the Burden of Identity

docs.abstract: It might be too much to ask voters to look past issues of gender and race.
docs.snippet: It might be too much to ask voters to look past issues of gender and race.

docs.lead_paragraph: A new debate is emerging over whether breast implants constitute the kind of annuity medicine that will entail regular surgical tuneups, exposing patients to increased medical risk and out-of-pocket expenses.
